cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest along/just south of Cuba today, then turning northwest into the Gulf of Mexico and toward the Texas-Louisiana Gulf Coast mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key to Key West (does not include PortMiami)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Dry Tortugas and numerous Cuban provinces; no warnings along the southeastern Florida mainland coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southern and central Cuba today, Florida Keys today, then the north-central U.S. Gulf Coast (TX/LA) Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain bands could bring occasional gusts below tropical-storm force (≤ 35 kt) Monday; overall 3 % chance of sustained gale-force winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Miami coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches possible in outer squalls Monday with locally higher totals.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low but non-zero risk of an isolated tornado in far southern Florida Monday.
